database_info.description: Unified physiotherapy exercise database with knowledge graph structure

en.name: Scapular Wall Slides
en.description: A shoulder mobility exercise targeting scapular control and upward rotation
instructions: Stand with your back flat against a wall
Place arms against wall in 'goalpost' position (90° shoulder abduction, 90° elbow flexion)
Slowly slide arms up the wall, maintaining contact throughout
Reach as high as comfortable without losing wall contact
Slowly lower back to starting position
cues: Keep lower back pressed against wall

en.name: Prone Scapular Retraction
en.description: Strengthening exercise for scapular stabilizers
instructions: Lie face down on treatment table
Arms at sides or in T-position
cues: Think about squeezing a pencil between shoulder blades

en.name: Pendulum Exercise
en.description: Gentle passive shoulder mobilization
instructions: Bend forward at waist, supporting with unaffected arm
Use body motion to create gentle swinging
Perform circles, forward/back, and side to side
cues: Movement comes from body, not shoulder

en.name: Quadruped Rock Back
en.description: Spinal mobility exercise emphasizing lumbar flexion
instructions: Slowly rock hips back toward heels
Keep arms extended and spine neutral
Rock back as far as comfortable

en.name: Dead Bug
en.description: Core stability exercise with anti-extension focus
instructions: Lie on back with arms pointing to ceiling
Bring knees to 90° hip and knee flexion
Slowly lower opposite arm and leg
Keep lower back pressed to floor
Return to start and alternate sides
cues: Press lower back into floor throughout
Breathe out as you lower limbs

en.name: Bird Dog
en.description: Core stability with anti-rotation component
instructions: Extend opposite arm and leg simultaneously
Keep hips level and spine neutral
Return to start and switch sides
cues: Imagine balancing a cup of water on lower back
Reach long through fingertips and toes

en.name: Straight Leg Raise
en.description: Hip flexor and quadriceps strengthening
instructions: Lie on back with one knee bent, other leg straight
Lift leg to height of opposite knee

en.name: Clamshells
en.description: Hip abductor strengthening exercise
instructions: Lie on side with hips and knees bent to 45°
Lift top knee while keeping feet touching

en.name: Heel Slides
en.description: Gentle knee flexion mobility exercise
instructions: Lie on back with legs straight
Bend knee as far as comfortable
cues: Keep heel in contact with surface

en.name: Quadriceps Sets
en.description: Isometric quadriceps activation
instructions: Lie or sit with leg straight

en.name: Ankle Pumps
en.description: Active ankle mobility and circulation exercise
instructions: Lie or sit with legs extended

en.name: Standing Heel Raise
en.description: Calf strengthening exercise

en.name: Bridge Exercise
en.description: Gluteal and core strengthening
instructions: Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat
Create straight line from knees to shoulders

en.name: Wall Sits
en.description: Isometric lower extremity strengthening

en.name: Cervical Retraction (Chin Tuck)
en.description: Postural exercise for neck alignment

en.name: Thoracic Extension on Foam Roller
en.description: Thoracic spine mobility exercise
instructions: Lie with foam roller under mid-back

en.name: Mini Squats
en.description: Functional lower extremity exercise

en.name: Step Ups
en.description: Functional strengthening and balance
instructions: Place one foot fully on step
Push through heel to step up

en.name: Single Leg Balance
en.description: Proprioception and balance training

en.name: Median Nerve Glides
en.description: Neural mobilization for median nerve
instructions: Extend arm to side at shoulder height

en.name: External Rotation at 90 Degrees
en.description: Rotator cuff strengthening in functional position
instructions: Stand with arm at 90° shoulder abduction

en.name: D2 Flexion PNF Pattern
en.description: Proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation pattern for shoulder
instructions: Start with arm across body, palm down
End position: arm up and out, thumb toward ceiling

en.name: Push-up Plus
en.description: Advanced serratus anterior strengthening
instructions: At top, push shoulder blades apart

en.name: Eccentric Bicep Curls
en.description: Eccentric strengthening for tennis elbow rehabilitation
instructions: Use both hands to curl weight up
Slowly lower weight with affected arm only

en.name: Ulnar Nerve Glides
en.description: Neural mobilization for ulnar nerve
instructions: Arm out to side, elbow bent
Side bend head away from arm

en.name: Tendon Glides
en.description: Finger flexor tendon mobilization

en.name: Grip Strengthening
en.description: Hand strength exercise using dynamometer

en.name: Side-lying Hip Abduction
en.description: Primary hip abductor strengthening
instructions: Lie on side with body straight
Lift top leg up and back slightly

en.name: Monster Walks
en.description: Dynamic hip stabilization exercise
instructions: Place resistance band around ankles or knees

en.name: Single Leg Deadlift
en.description: Unilateral posterior chain strengthening
instructions: Hinge at hip, reach toward floor

en.name: Terminal Knee Extension
en.description: VMO strengthening exercise
common_errors: Too much knee flexion at start

en.name: Single Leg Squat
en.description: Advanced unilateral lower extremity strengthening
instructions: Slowly squat down on single leg

en.name: Lateral Step Down
en.description: Eccentric control and hip stability
instructions: Slowly lower outside leg to floor

en.name: Calf Stretch - Gastrocnemius
en.description: Static stretch for gastrocnemius muscle
instructions: Front leg bent, hands on wall

en.name: Calf Stretch - Soleus
en.description: Targeted stretch for deeper calf muscle
instructions: Step back leg back, knee bent
Front leg bent, hands on wall
Lean forward while keeping back knee bent

en.name: Toe Raises
en.description: Anterior tibialis strengthening
cues: Lift toes as high as possible

en.name: Alphabet Draws
en.description: Multi-planar ankle mobility exercise
instructions: Use foot to 'draw' letters in air

en.name: Towel Scrunches
en.description: Intrinsic foot muscle strengthening
instructions: Use toes to scrunch towel toward you
Pick up towel using only toes

en.name: Marble Pick-up
en.description: Fine motor control for foot muscles
instructions: Use toes to pick up marbles
Use one foot at a time

en.name: Cat-Cow Stretch
en.description: Spinal segmental mobility exercise

en.name: Thoracic Rotation
en.description: Thoracic spine rotational mobility

en.name: Prone Press-up
en.description: Lumbar extension mobility exercise
instructions: Press up with arms, keep hips down

en.name: McGill Curl-up
en.description: Spinal stability focused abdominal exercise
instructions: One knee bent, other leg straight

en.name: McGill Side Plank
en.description: Lateral core stability exercise
instructions: Lie on side, elbow under shoulder
Lift hips to create straight line
cues: Straight line from head to feet

en.name: Turkish Get-up
en.description: Complex movement pattern for total body integration
instructions: Start lying with arm pointing up
Roll to elbow, then to hand

en.name: Bear Crawl
en.description: Dynamic stability and coordination exercise

en.name: Farmer's Walk
en.description: Loaded carry for functional strength

en.name: Deep Breathing Exercise
en.description: Diaphragmatic breathing for respiratory rehabilitation
instructions: One hand on chest, one on belly
Breathe in through nose, belly rises

en.name: Pursed Lip Breathing
en.description: Breathing technique for COPD management
instructions: Exhale twice as long as inhale

en.name: Stair Climbing Training
en.description: Functional cardiovascular and strength training
instructions: Use actual stairs or step platform
Step up with full foot contact

en.name: Weight Shifting in Standing
en.description: Balance training for stroke and neurological conditions
instructions: Shift weight to one foot, lift other slightly
Return to center and repeat other side

en.name: Sit to Stand Training
en.description: Functional mobility training for neurological patients
instructions: Feet flat on floor, hip-width apart
Lean forward and push through heels to stand
Control descent when sitting back down
Use arms for assistance if needed initially

en.name: Facilitated Arm Movements
en.description: Motor re-education for stroke patients
instructions: Sit with affected arm supported on table
Use unaffected hand to assist movement
cues: Use good arm to help initially

en.name: Bed Mobility Training
en.description: Basic mobility skills for neurological rehabilitation
instructions: Work on scooting up in bed
Practice bridging and moving in bed
common_errors: Trying to do too much at once

en.name: Dual Task Training
en.description: Cognitive-motor integration for neurological conditions
instructions: Perform balance task while doing cognitive task
Examples: count backwards while standing on one leg

en.name: Gait Training Forward/Backward
en.description: Directional gait training for neurological patients
instructions: Start with forward walking with support
Work on cadence and step length

en.name: Constraint Induced Movement Therapy
en.description: Intensive therapy for stroke recovery
instructions: Practice functional tasks with affected arm

en.name: Visual Scanning Exercises
en.description: Visual attention training for stroke patients
instructions: Patient scans to find specific items
cues: Turn head to see full field

en.name: Rhythmic Initiation
en.description: PNF technique for movement facilitation
instructions: Start with passive movement in rhythm
Use counting or music for rhythm
cues: Relax and let me move you
Now help me with the movement
Now do it on your own

en.name: Postural Awareness Training
en.description: Body awareness and alignment training
instructions: Feel difference between good and poor posture

en.name: Reciprocal Coordination Patterns
en.description: Motor coordination training for neurological patients
instructions: Coordinate opposite arm and leg movements

en.name: Functional Reach Training
en.description: Task-specific reaching practice
instructions: Reach for objects at various heights/distances
Practice picking up and placing items

en.name: Stepping Reactions Training
en.description: Balance reaction training for fall prevention
instructions: Train forward, backward, and sideways steps

en.name: Cognitive-Motor Integration
en.description: Complex attention and movement training

en.name: Mirror Therapy
en.description: Visual feedback therapy for stroke and phantom pain
instructions: Move unaffected arm while watching mirror
cues: Focus on the movement you see

en.name: Sensory Re-education
en.description: Sensory awareness and discrimination training
instructions: Use eyes closed, then eyes open for feedback
Progress from large to fine discrimination

en.name: Trunk Rotation in Sitting
en.description: Trunk control and rotation training
instructions: Sit with feet flat on floor
common_errors: Moving whole body instead of trunk

en.name: Finger Individuation Exercises
en.description: Fine motor control training for hand function
instructions: Practice moving one finger at a time
Work on finger extension and flexion

en.name: Ankle Strategy Training
en.description: Balance strategy training for postural control
instructions: Practice small sway corrections using ankles
Keep hips and knees relatively stable
cues: Rock at ankles like tree in wind

en.name: Task-Specific ADL Training
en.description: Activities of daily living practice

en.name: Locomotor Training on Treadmill
en.description: Body weight supported treadmill training
instructions: Start with slow speed and high support
Gradually reduce support and increase speed
common_errors: Too much weight bearing too early

en.name: Proprioceptive Training - Eyes Closed
en.description: Proprioceptive awareness and balance training
instructions: Perform balance activities with eyes closed
cues: Feel where your body is in space
Use your inner sense of balance

en.name: Cognitive Strategies for Movement
en.description: Mental strategies to improve movement
instructions: Use visual cues for movement initiation

en.name: Spasticity Management Exercises
en.description: Exercises to manage muscle spasticity
instructions: Apply ice or heat as appropriate

en.name: Transfer Training - Bed to Chair
en.description: Safe transfer technique training
instructions: Position chair at 45-degree angle to bed
Lean forward and push to standing

en.name: Oral Motor Swallowing Exercises
en.description: Exercises to improve swallowing function

en.name: Attention Training Exercises
en.description: Cognitive rehabilitation for attention deficits

en.name: Memory Strategy Training
en.description: Learning compensatory memory techniques
instructions: Learn to use external memory aids

en.name: Communication Device Training
en.description: Learning to use augmentative communication

en.name: Vestibular Habituation Exercises
en.description: Exercises to reduce dizziness and improve vestibular function
instructions: Perform movements that provoke mild dizziness
Practice head movements in all planes

en.name: Gaze Stabilization Exercises
en.description: Exercises to improve visual stability during head movement
instructions: Move head left and right while keeping eyes on target
Progress to up and down movements

en.name: Motor Imagery Training
en.description: Mental practice of movement for motor recovery
cues: See, feel, and hear the movement
Make it as real as possible

en.name: Bilateral Coordination Training
en.description: Training both sides of body to work together

en.name: Environmental Mobility Training
en.description: Mobility training in varied environments

en.name: Fatigue Management Strategies
en.description: Learning to manage and conserve energy

en.name: Apraxia Treatment Exercises
en.description: Training for motor planning difficulties
instructions: Break complex tasks into simple steps

en.name: Executive Function Training
en.description: Training higher-level cognitive skills
common_errors: Tasks not relevant to daily life

en.name: Social Communication Training
en.description: Training social aspects of communication

en.name: Driving Rehabilitation Exercises
en.description: Assessment and training for return to driving

en.name: Community Re-integration Training
en.description: Training for return to community activities

en.name: Wheelchair Mobility Training
en.description: Training for independent wheelchair use

en.name: Neurological Pain Management
en.description: Techniques for managing neurological pain

en.name: Sleep Positioning and Hygiene
en.description: Positioning strategies for quality sleep
instructions: Use pillows for support and alignment

en.name: Respiratory Muscle Training for Neuro
en.description: Breathing exercises for neurological conditions

en.name: Adaptive Technology Training
en.description: Learning to use assistive technology
cues: Take time to learn the system

en.name: Caregiver Training
en.description: Training family members and caregivers

en.name: Self-Assessment and Goal Setting
en.description: Training patients to track their progress

en.name: Neuroplasticity-Based Training
en.description: Exercises designed to promote brain plasticity
common_errors: Tasks too easy or too hard

en.name: Telerehabilitation Training
en.description: Training for remote rehabilitation participation

en.name: Return to Work Training
en.description: Vocational rehabilitation for neurological conditions

en.name: Tummy Time Progressive
en.description: Essential prone positioning for infant development
instructions: Place infant on firm, safe surface in prone position
Start with 3-5 minutes several times daily
Encourage head lifting with toys or parent interaction
cues: Make it fun with toys and interaction
common_errors: Forcing position when infant is upset

en.name: Supported Sitting Balance
en.description: Progressive sitting balance training for infants
instructions: Position infant in supported sitting with pillows around
Gradually reduce support as balance improves

en.name: Crawling Pattern Development
en.description: Facilitate normal crawling pattern development
instructions: Start with weight bearing on hands and knees
common_errors: Always carrying instead of floor time

en.name: Cruising and Pre-Walking
en.description: Transition from cruising to independent walking
instructions: Use push toys for walking practice

en.name: Sensory Integration Play
en.description: Activities to support sensory processing development
instructions: Offer proprioceptive input through weight bearing

en.name: Fine Motor Grasping Progression
en.description: Progressive fine motor skill development
instructions: Start with reaching and grasping large objects
cues: Size objects appropriately for skill level
common_errors: Objects too small or too large

en.name: Balance Beam Walking
en.description: Dynamic balance training for children
instructions: Start with wide, low balance beam
Begin with hands held for support
Make it into games and challenges
cues: Look forward, not down at feet
common_errors: Making it too serious, not fun

en.name: Playground Skill Development
en.description: Using playground equipment for motor skill development
instructions: Start with basic equipment like swings

en.name: Postural Control Activities
en.description: Activities to improve postural control and alignment
instructions: Practice maintaining good posture in sitting
Use postural challenges on unstable surfaces
cues: Good alignment from head to toe

en.name: Therapeutic Ball Activities
en.description: Ball exercises adapted for pediatric development
instructions: Start with supported activities on ball
Include sitting, prone, and supine positions
common_errors: Moving too fast or too much

en.name: Motor Planning Obstacle Course
en.description: Obstacle courses to develop motor planning skills
instructions: Create courses with various movement challenges
cues: Take your time to figure it out

en.name: Bilateral Coordination Activities
en.description: Activities to develop both sides of body working together
instructions: Add reciprocal movements like bike pedaling
cues: Cross over to the other side

en.name: Visual Motor Integration Play
en.description: Activities combining visual skills with motor actions
instructions: Start with simple reaching and grasping tasks
Progress to throwing and catching activities
cues: Match your movements to what you see
Take your time to be accurate

en.name: Jumping and Landing Progression
en.description: Progressive jumping skill development
instructions: Start with step-downs from low height
Progress to jumping up onto surfaces
cues: Land like a ninja, quiet and controlled

en.name: Rhythm and Movement Activities
en.description: Using music and rhythm for motor development
instructions: Start with simple clapping to beat
Add marching and stepping to music
Practice starting and stopping with music
cues: Feel the rhythm in your body

en.name: Social Motor Games
en.description: Group activities combining motor skills with social interaction
instructions: Modify rules to ensure everyone can participate
cues: Everyone can play and have fun

en.name: Strengthening Through Play
en.description: Building strength through play-based activities
instructions: Use animal walks for total body strengthening
Include playground activities like monkey bars
cues: Pretend to be a strong animal
common_errors: Making it too much like adult exercise

en.name: Cognitive Motor Integration
en.description: Activities combining thinking and movement
instructions: Add color or shape recognition tasks
Combine academic learning with motor tasks
cues: Use your brain and body together
common_errors: Making it too academic, not fun

en.name: Handwriting Readiness Activities
en.description: Preparing fine motor skills for writing success
instructions: Work on letter formation in various media
cues: Hold pencil like a bird's beak
common_errors: Making it too serious, not playful

en.name: Adaptive Equipment Training
en.description: Learning to use adaptive equipment effectively
instructions: Include maintenance and care of equipment
Involve family and caregivers in training
cues: This helps you be more independent
common_errors: Not involving child in equipment selection

en.name: Sensory Diet Activities
en.description: Individualized sensory activities for regulation
instructions: Identify child's sensory preferences and needs
Include calming and alerting activities as needed
Practice throughout the day as scheduled
Teach child to recognize their sensory needs
cues: This helps your body feel just right

en.name: Transition Movement Activities
en.description: Movement activities to ease transitions between activities
instructions: Use movement breaks between seated activities
Include calming or energizing movements as needed
Make transitions predictable with movement cues

en.name: Executive Function Movement Games
en.description: Games that challenge executive function through movement
instructions: Include stop-and-go games like Red Light Green Light
Add working memory challenges to movement

en.name: Playground Safety and Skills
en.description: Teaching safe playground use and skill development
instructions: Teach proper use of each piece of equipment
Address risk assessment and safety awareness

en.name: Self-Care Skill Development
en.description: Developing independence in daily self-care activities
instructions: Break complex tasks into manageable steps
Practice dressing, grooming, and feeding skills
cues: You can do it step by step
common_errors: Doing too much for the child

en.name: Therapeutic Horseback Riding Preparation
en.description: Preparing for therapeutic horseback riding activities
instructions: Work on following directions and safety rules
Build core strength and postural control

en.name: Neurodevelopmental Treatment Techniques
en.description: NDT approaches for children with neurological conditions
instructions: Use handling techniques to facilitate normal movement
cues: Let me help guide your movement
This is how it should move

en.name: Aquatic Readiness Activities
en.description: Preparing for water-based therapeutic activities
instructions: Start with water play and exploration
Practice breath control and water comfort
Build tolerance for water on face and body

en.name: Technology Integration Activities
en.description: Using technology to enhance motor and functional skills
instructions: Use apps and games for motor skill practice
Balance technology use with physical activity
cues: Balance screen time with active time

en.name: Community Mobility Preparation
en.description: Preparing for safe and independent community navigation
instructions: Include wheelchair or mobility aid skills
Include social interaction in community settings

en.name: Feeding and Swallowing Motor Skills
en.description: Developing oral motor skills for safe feeding
instructions: Work on jaw stability and tongue mobility

en.name: Sleep Position and Movement
en.description: Optimizing sleep positioning for development and comfort
instructions: Ensure safe sleep positioning following guidelines
Address positioning needs for children with disabilities
Include movement opportunities during wake periods
Consider equipment needs for safe sleep

en.name: Wheelchair Skills Training
en.description: Developing independent wheelchair mobility skills

en.name: Prosthetic Training Activities
en.description: Learning to effectively use prosthetic devices
instructions: Start with wearing tolerance and comfort
cues: This helps you do what you want to do

en.name: School Readiness Motor Skills
en.description: Motor skills needed for school success
instructions: Include fine motor skills for writing
Practice social motor skills for playground
cues: You're getting ready for school success
common_errors: Too much focus on academic vs. motor
Starting too close to school entry

en.name: Adolescent Fitness Development
en.description: Age-appropriate fitness and strength training
common_errors: Making it too serious, not enjoyable

en.name: Pain Management Through Movement
en.description: Using movement and activity for pain management
instructions: Address fear and anxiety around movement
cues: Gentle movement can help with pain
You have tools to help manage pain
common_errors: Avoiding all movement due to pain

en.name: Family-Centered Activity Training
en.description: Involving family in therapeutic activities and home programs

en.name: Outdoor Adventure Skills
en.description: Developing skills for outdoor recreation and adventure
instructions: Start with basic outdoor safety skills
Include hiking, camping, and nature activities

en.name: Transition to Adult Services
en.description: Preparing adolescents for transition to adult services and independence
instructions: Assess adult living and work skill needs
cues: These skills will help you be independent
Practice speaking up for your needs
common_errors: Not involving the young person in planning

en.name: Creative Arts and Movement
en.description: Combining creative expression with motor skill development
instructions: Include dance, drama, and movement activities
Practice art activities requiring motor skills
Use music and rhythm for motor learning
Allow for individual expression and style
cues: There's no wrong way to be creative
common_errors: Too much focus on product vs. process

en.name: Cultural and Community Activities
en.description: Incorporating cultural activities and community participation
instructions: Include activities from child's cultural background
cues: Your culture is important and valued

en.name: Emotional Regulation Through Movement
en.description: Using movement activities to support emotional regulation
instructions: Practice emotional awareness through body signals
cues: Movement can help you feel better
You have tools to help yourself
common_errors: Focusing only on behavior vs. underlying needs

EX_144.name: Peer Interaction and Social Motor Skills

en.name: Peer Interaction and Social Motor Skills
en.description: Building social skills through movement and play activities
instructions: Practice taking turns and sharing equipment
Build empathy and understanding of differences
cues: Friends play together and help each other
Everyone can participate in their own way
common_errors: Focusing only on motor vs. social skills

en.name: Body Awareness and Anatomy Education
en.description: Teaching body awareness and basic anatomy through movement
instructions: Practice identifying body parts and functions
Include activities showing how body parts work together
cues: Your body is amazing and unique
Understanding your body helps you take care of it

en.name: Motor Learning and Memory Strategies
en.description: Teaching strategies for learning and remembering motor skills
instructions: Use visual, verbal, and kinesthetic cues
cues: Try it different ways to learn better
You can figure out how to improve
common_errors: Too much focus on perfect performance

en.name: Environmental Adaptation Skills
en.description: Learning to adapt motor skills to different environments
instructions: Practice skills in various settings and surfaces
Address lighting, noise, and space variations
Build confidence in new or challenging spaces
cues: Every place is a little different
You can adapt and figure it out
Practice in new places makes you flexible

en.name: Assistive Technology Integration
en.description: Learning to effectively use assistive technology for daily activities
instructions: Start with device familiarization and comfort
Practice functional use in daily activities
Address social aspects of technology use
Build advocacy skills for technology needs
cues: Technology helps you do what you want
Practice makes technology easier to use
You can help others understand your technology

en.name: Health and Wellness Education
en.description: Teaching health and wellness concepts through movement and activity
instructions: Include nutrition and physical activity education
Address sleep, stress, and mental health
cues: Healthy choices help you feel your best
You can learn to take care of yourself
Your health is important and worth protecting
common_errors: Not relating to individual health needs

en.name: Lifelong Physical Activity Participation
en.description: Building foundation for lifelong physical activity and recreation
instructions: Explore various types of physical activities
Focus on enjoyment and personal satisfaction
Address barriers and facilitators to participation
Include family and community activity options
Build confidence and competence in chosen activities
cues: Find activities you love to do
Being active can be fun for your whole life
There are many ways to be physically active
common_errors: Too much focus on competitive sports

en.name: Tennis Forehand Preparation Drills
en.description: Sport-specific conditioning for tennis forehand mechanics
instructions: Focus on shoulder external rotation in preparation phase
Emphasize weight transfer from back to front foot
Include plyometric elements for power generation

en.name: Basketball Defensive Slide Training
en.description: Lateral movement training for basketball defense
instructions: Maintain low athletic stance throughout movement
Keep feet wide and parallel during slides
Emphasize quick first step and direction changes
Practice both lead leg and trail leg emphasis
Include reaction drills with visual cues

en.name: Soccer Shooting Mechanics Training
en.description: Biomechanical training for soccer shooting technique
instructions: Focus on plant foot positioning and stability
Emphasize hip flexion and knee extension in kicking leg
Practice contact point accuracy on ball
Include both power and placement shooting
Work on shooting from various angles and distances

en.name: Baseball Pitcher's Conditioning Program
en.description: Comprehensive conditioning for baseball pitchers

en.name: Volleyball Attack Approach Training
en.description: Training for volleyball spike approach and attack
instructions: Focus on penultimate step for vertical jump optimization
Work on timing with ball trajectory
Include approach from various court positions

en.name: Swimming Stroke Technique Drills
en.description: Technical training for swimming stroke mechanics
instructions: Focus on high elbow catch and pull phases
Emphasize body rotation and streamline position
Work on kick timing and coordination
Include stroke count and distance per stroke drills

en.name: Golf Swing Mechanics Training
en.description: Biomechanical training for golf swing efficiency
instructions: Focus on proper setup and posture
Practice weight transfer from back to front foot
Work on tempo and rhythm consistency
Include exercises for core stability and rotation

EX_158.name: Track and Field Sprint Start Training

en.name: Track and Field Sprint Start Training
en.description: Technical training for sprint start and acceleration
instructions: Practice proper block setup and body positioning
Focus on explosive first step and drive phase
Emphasize forward lean and acceleration posture
Work on arm drive coordination with leg action
Include reaction time training with various stimuli

en.name: Cycling Power Development Training
en.description: Power and efficiency training for cycling performance
instructions: Focus on optimal pedaling mechanics and cadence
Practice interval training for power development
Emphasize proper bike fit and positioning
Work on both seated and standing climbing techniques
Include single-leg drills for pedaling efficiency

en.name: Wrestling Takedown Conditioning
en.description: Conditioning for wrestling takedown techniques
instructions: Practice level change mechanics for shot setups
Focus on explosive penetration step and drive
Emphasize grip strength and hand fighting
Work on balance and base during contact
Include conditioning for multiple takedown attempts

en.name: Gymnastics Landing Mechanics Training
en.description: Training for safe and controlled gymnastics landings
instructions: Practice proper landing position and technique
Focus on shock absorption through lower extremity
Work on various landing scenarios and heights
Include progressions from basic to complex landings

en.name: Ice Hockey Skating Power Training
en.description: Off-ice training for hockey skating power and technique
instructions: Practice skating stance and stride mechanics
Focus on lateral push-off and recovery phases
Emphasize core stability during directional changes
Work on acceleration and deceleration techniques
Include sport-specific agility and reaction drills

en.name: Rock Climbing Finger Strength Training
en.description: Finger and grip strength training for rock climbing
instructions: Practice various grip positions and hold types
Focus on progressive overload for finger strength
Emphasize proper warm-up and injury prevention
Work on both maximum strength and endurance
Include technique training for efficient movement

en.name: Martial Arts Kicking Technique Training
en.description: Technical and conditioning training for martial arts kicks
instructions: Practice proper chamber and extension phases
Focus on hip flexibility and range of motion
Emphasize balance and control throughout kick
Work on various kick types and combinations
Include conditioning for kicking power and speed

en.name: Rowing Stroke Mechanics Training
en.description: Technical training for rowing stroke efficiency
instructions: Focus on proper catch and drive phases
Emphasize leg drive followed by back and arms
Work on stroke rate and power coordination
Include both steady-state and interval training

en.name: Badminton Overhead Smash Training
en.description: Training for badminton overhead smash technique and power
instructions: Focus on shoulder external rotation in preparation
Emphasize core rotation and power generation
Work on contact point timing and accuracy
Include plyometric exercises for explosive power

en.name: American Football Blocking Technique Training
en.description: Technical and strength training for football blocking
instructions: Practice proper stance and first step technique
Focus on hand placement and leverage
Emphasize core stability and base of support
Work on various blocking schemes and angles
cues: Keep head up and back straight

en.name: Skiing Parallel Turn Training
en.description: Off-snow training for skiing parallel turn technique

EX_202.name: Aquatic Arm Circles and Cross-Body Movements

en.name: Aquatic Arm Circles and Cross-Body Movements
en.description: Multi-planar shoulder strengthening using water resistance
instructions: Perform large arm circles forward and backward
Add cross-body movements at shoulder height
cues: Feel water resistance in all directions

en.name: Water Jogging in Place
en.description: High-intensity aquatic cardiovascular exercise
instructions: Use flotation belt for deep water or stand in chest-deep water
Mimic running motion with arms and legs

en.name: Aquatic Leg Swings Multi-Planar
en.description: Hip mobility and strengthening in multiple planes using water resistance
instructions: Stand holding pool edge or use flotation support
Swing leg forward and backward (sagittal plane)
Perform leg swings side to side (frontal plane)
Control movement speed for desired resistance
common_errors: Using momentum instead of muscle control

en.name: Aquatic Squats and Lunges
en.description: Functional lower extremity strengthening with reduced joint loading
instructions: Perform squats with water support reducing joint stress
Add forward, reverse, and lateral lunges
Focus on controlled descent and ascent
Use water resistance for added challenge
common_errors: Not using full range of motion

en.name: Aquatic Balance and Proprioception Training
en.description: Balance training utilizing water's unstable environment
instructions: Stand on one foot in chest-deep water
Perform balance challenges with eyes open and closed
Add upper extremity movements while balancing
Progress to unstable surface equipment if available
common_errors: Relying too much on upper extremity support

en.name: Aquatic Gait Training Progressions
en.description: Progressive gait training with adjustable weight bearing
instructions: Start in deeper water for maximum unloading
Focus on normal heel-toe gait pattern
Progress speed and complexity as tolerated

en.name: Aquatic Plyometric Training
en.description: Power development with reduced impact landing forces
instructions: Perform jumping movements in chest-deep water
Include vertical jumps, broad jumps, and lateral bounds

en.name: Aquatic Core Strengthening
en.description: Core strengthening utilizing water's three-dimensional resistance
instructions: Use flotation equipment for supported positions
Perform leg lifts, bicycle movements, and twisting motions

en.name: Aquatic Stretching and Flexibility
en.description: Relaxation and flexibility training in warm water environment
instructions: Use water buoyancy to assist stretching

en.name: Aquatic Spinal Decompression Exercises
en.description: Spinal decompression and mobility using water buoyancy
instructions: Use flotation support for comfortable floating

en.name: Pelvic Floor Muscle Training (Kegels)
en.description: Foundational exercise for pelvic floor strength and function

EX_251.name: LCL Injury - Lateral Knee Stability Training

en.name: LCL Injury - Lateral Knee Stability Training
en.description: Progressive stability training for lateral collateral ligament recovery
instructions: Begin with partial weight bearing as tolerated
Practice single-leg balance with lateral perturbations
Progress to lateral step-downs with control
Add resistance band for varus/valgus control
Include proprioceptive training on unstable surfaces
common_errors: Progressing too quickly to full weight bearing

en.name: PCL Tear - Posterior Glide Prevention
en.description: Quadriceps strengthening to prevent posterior tibial translation
instructions: Avoid hamstring strengthening in early phases
Focus on quadriceps strengthening in closed chain
Perform quad sets with posterior support
Progress to partial squats with anterior weight shift

en.name: ATFL Tear - Ankle Inversion Control
en.description: Progressive stability training for anterior talofibular ligament recovery
instructions: Practice single-leg balance with eyes closed
Progress to balance on unstable surfaces
Add sport-specific cutting movements when appropriate
cues: Keep ankle neutral, don't let it roll in

en.name: CFL Tear - Lateral Ankle Stabilization
en.description: Advanced stabilization for calcaneofibular ligament recovery
instructions: Add agility ladder drills with lateral emphasis

en.name: UCL Elbow - Valgus Stress Protection
en.description: Protective exercises and strengthening for ulnar collateral ligament
instructions: Progress to controlled range of motion exercises

en.name: RCL Elbow - Lateral Stability Training
en.description: Lateral elbow stability for radial collateral ligament recovery
instructions: Include grip strengthening with emphasis on lateral pinch
Practice functional reaching and lifting patterns

en.name: AC Joint - Superior Translation Control
en.description: Controlled exercises for acromioclavicular joint recovery
instructions: Avoid overhead lifting in early phases

common_errors: Not using arm support during healing

en.name: SC Joint - Anterior-Posterior Stability

Avoid forceful arm swinging or lifting

Focus on postural awareness and correction

en.name: Coracoclavicular Ligament - Vertical Stability

en.name: MCL Progressive Loading Protocol

Progress to controlled valgus stress exercises
Include lateral movement patterns with progression
Add plyometric training in later phases
common_errors: Applying excessive valgus stress too early

en.name: Ligament Scar Tissue Management
en.description: Techniques to optimize ligament healing and prevent adhesions
instructions: Apply gentle cross-friction massage to healing ligament
Perform controlled stress to promote proper collagen alignment
Include heat therapy before mobility exercises
Use gentle stretching within pain-free range
Progress tissue loading gradually over time
common_errors: Aggressive treatment too early in healing

en.name: Proprioceptive Ligament Training
en.description: Restore joint position sense and mechanoreceptor function
instructions: Perform balance training on various surfaces
Add perturbation training for reactive stability

en.name: Functional Ligament Integration
en.description: Integrate ligament stability into functional movement patterns
instructions: Test ligament function under sport demands
common_errors: Inadequate testing before return to activity

en.name: ACL Prevention Protocol

Include plyometric progression with proper form
cues: Land softly with knees over toes
Keep knees behind toes during squatting

en.name: Ligament Healing Nutrition Support

instructions: Ensure adequate protein intake for collagen synthesis
Include vitamin C for collagen cross-linking

en.name: Sleep and Recovery for Ligaments

instructions: Maintain 7-9 hours of quality sleep nightly
Use proper positioning to support injured area

en.name: Return to Sport Testing - Ligaments

en.name: Chronic Ligament Instability Management

en.name: Multi-Ligament Injury Protocol

en.name: Geriatric Ligament Injury Considerations

en.name: Post-Surgical Ligament Reconstruction

en.name: Mental Health and Ligament Recovery

Explain complex concepts in understandable terms
Communicate effectively with healthcare team members

en.name: Outcome Measurement in Ligament Rehabilitation
en.description: Implement comprehensive outcome measurement systems
instructions: Use validated outcome measures for ligament injuries
Measure functional outcomes and quality of life
Use data to improve clinical decision-making

en.name: Risk Management in Ligament Rehabilitation
en.description: Implement comprehensive risk management in ligament care
instructions: Identify and assess clinical and legal risks
Ensure informed consent and shared decision-making
Have emergency procedures and protocols in place
cues: Identify risks before they become problems

en.name: Future Directions in Ligament Rehabilitation
en.description: Prepare for and shape the future of ligament rehabilitation
instructions: Stay informed about emerging trends and technologies
Participate in research and development activities
Contribute to policy development and advocacy
Prepare for changing healthcare delivery models
Lead innovation and advancement in the field
cues: Prepare for the future of healthcare
Shape the direction of the field

en.name: Comprehensive Ligament Health Program
en.description: Holistic approach to ligament health across all populations and settings
instructions: Integrate all aspects of ligament health and rehabilitation
Address prevention, treatment, and long-term management
Promote lifelong ligament health and wellness
common_errors: Taking narrow approach to ligament care

en.name: Cardiac Rehabilitation - Phase I (Inpatient)
en.description: Early mobilization for cardiac patients in hospital setting
instructions: Begin with passive range of motion exercises
Include breathing exercises and coughing techniques
Monitor heart rate and blood pressure continuously
Progress from bed rest to sitting to standing
cues: Stop if chest pain or shortness of breath occurs

en.name: Cardiac Rehabilitation - Phase II (Outpatient)
en.description: Supervised exercise training for cardiac recovery
instructions: Exercise at 60-80% of maximum heart rate
Include aerobic training 3-5 times per week
Add resistance training with light weights
Monitor ECG and vital signs during exercise
cues: Stay within target heart rate zone

en.name: Heart Failure Exercise Training
en.description: Safe exercise program for chronic heart failure patients
instructions: Start with 10-15 minutes of low intensity exercise
Include interval training with rest periods
Focus on activities of daily living simulation
Monitor for signs of fluid overload
cues: Stop if unusual shortness of breath
Weigh daily to monitor fluid status

en.name: COPD Pulmonary Rehabilitation
en.description: Comprehensive exercise program for COPD management
instructions: Include breathing exercises and pursed lip breathing
Perform upper and lower extremity endurance training
Use oxygen therapy as prescribed during exercise
cues: Use pursed lip breathing during exertion

en.name: Post-COVID-19 Graduated Exercise Therapy
en.description: Gradual exercise progression for long COVID recovery
instructions: Start with very low intensity activities
Include pacing strategies to avoid post-exertional malaise
Monitor symptoms for 24-48 hours after exercise
Progress only if no symptom worsening

en.name: Interstitial Lung Disease Exercise Program
en.description: Exercise training for patients with restrictive lung disease
instructions: Monitor oxygen saturation closely during exercise
Include both aerobic and strength training components
Focus on breathing techniques and energy conservation
Adjust intensity based on oxygen levels
cues: Stop if oxygen levels drop significantly
common_errors: Not using supplemental oxygen when prescribed

en.name: Pulmonary Hypertension Safe Exercise
en.description: Carefully monitored exercise for pulmonary hypertension patients
instructions: Focus on low to moderate intensity activities
Monitor heart rate and oxygen saturation continuously
cues: Keep exercise intensity low to moderate
Stop if chest pain or severe shortness of breath

en.name: Peripheral Arterial Disease Walking Program
en.description: Structured walking program to improve claudication symptoms
instructions: Walk until moderate claudication pain occurs
Rest until pain subsides, then resume walking
Gradually increase walking duration over time
Perform 3 times per week for at least 30 minutes
common_errors: Stopping at first sign of discomfort

en.name: Respiratory Muscle Training
en.description: Targeted training to strengthen breathing muscles
instructions: Use inspiratory muscle training device at prescribed resistance
Monitor for fatigue and adjust accordingly

en.name: Cardiac Transplant Exercise Progression
en.description: Specialized exercise program for cardiac transplant recipients
instructions: Begin with extended warm-up due to denervated heart
Use rate of perceived exertion rather than target heart rate
Include resistance training to counteract medication effects
Monitor for signs of infection or rejection
cues: Watch for unusual fatigue or symptoms
common_errors: Using heart rate as primary guide

en.name: Lung Transplant Rehabilitation
en.description: Comprehensive rehabilitation for lung transplant recipients
instructions: Monitor oxygen saturation continuously during exercise
Address medication side effects on exercise
Watch for signs of infection or rejection

en.name: Mechanical Ventilation Weaning Exercises
en.description: Progressive exercises to support ventilator weaning
instructions: Begin with passive range of motion exercises
Progress to active exercises as tolerated

en.name: Asthma Exercise Management
en.description: Safe exercise strategies for people with asthma
instructions: Use bronchodilator before exercise as prescribed
Include extended warm-up and cool-down periods
Choose appropriate exercise types and environments
Monitor peak flow before and after exercise
cues: Stop if wheezing or severe shortness of breath

en.name: Sleep Apnea Exercise Program
en.description: Exercise program to support sleep apnea treatment
instructions: Include oropharyngeal exercises to strengthen airway muscles
Add cardiovascular exercise for weight management
Consider exercise timing to avoid sleep disruption
Include throat and tongue strengthening exercises
common_errors: Not addressing upper airway muscle strength

en.name: Cystic Fibrosis Exercise Program
en.description: Comprehensive exercise program for cystic fibrosis management
instructions: Include resistance training for bone health

en.name: Hypertension Exercise Prescription
en.description: Evidence-based exercise program for blood pressure management
instructions: Include moderate intensity aerobic exercise 150 min/week
Add resistance training 2-3 times per week
Monitor blood pressure response to exercise
Avoid isometric exercises that raise blood pressure
Include dynamic flexibility and stress reduction
cues: Exercise regularly for blood pressure control
Avoid holding breath during resistance exercises

en.name: Atrial Fibrillation Exercise Management
en.description: Safe exercise strategies for patients with atrial fibrillation
instructions: Monitor heart rate and rhythm during exercise
Use rate-based rather than rhythm-based targets
Be aware of anticoagulation medication effects
Include activities that minimize fall risk
Stop exercise if irregular rhythm worsens
cues: Focus on rate control during exercise
Be cautious with contact sports if on anticoagulants
common_errors: Participating in high fall-risk activities while anticoagulated

en.name: Diabetes Exercise Prescription
en.description: Comprehensive exercise program for diabetes management
instructions: Include both aerobic and resistance training
Monitor blood glucose before and after exercise
Adjust carbohydrate intake or medication as needed
Include foot care and neuropathy precautions
Exercise at consistent times when possible
common_errors: Not monitoring blood glucose around exercise
Exercising with very high or low blood sugar

en.name: Chronic Kidney Disease Exercise
en.description: Exercise program adapted for chronic kidney disease patients
instructions: Start with low to moderate intensity exercise
Monitor for fluid overload and electrolyte imbalances
Include bone-loading exercises for renal osteodystrophy
Coordinate with dialysis schedule if applicable
Address anemia effects on exercise tolerance

en.name: Dialysis Patient Exercise Program
en.description: Exercise strategies for patients undergoing dialysis
instructions: Focus on maintaining muscle mass and strength
Include cardiovascular exercise on non-dialysis days
Monitor fluid status and blood pressure
cues: Use dialysis time for gentle exercise

en.name: Vestibular Habituation Exercises
en.description: Exercises to reduce dizziness through vestibular adaptation
instructions: Perform specific head movements that provoke mild dizziness
common_errors: Not being consistent with daily practice

en.name: Canalith Repositioning (Epley Maneuver)
en.description: Specific maneuver to treat posterior canal BPPV
instructions: Position patient sitting with legs extended
Turn head 45 degrees toward affected ear
Quickly move to lying position with head extended
Turn head 90 degrees to opposite side
cues: Hold each position until vertigo stops

en.name: Gaze Stabilization Training
en.description: Exercises to improve visual stability during head movement
instructions: Focus on stationary target while moving head
Perform horizontal and vertical head movements
Progress speed while maintaining visual clarity

en.name: Concussion Graduated Return to Activity
en.description: Systematic progression back to activity after concussion
instructions: Begin with light cognitive and physical activity
Progress through stages only if asymptomatic
Include both cognitive and physical challenges
Monitor symptoms for 24 hours after each stage
Return to previous stage if symptoms worsen

en.name: Post-Concussion Dual Task Training
en.description: Combined cognitive and physical tasks to improve function
instructions: Perform physical activities while completing cognitive tasks
Start with simple combinations and progress complexity
Monitor cognitive fatigue and physical symptoms
common_errors: Focusing on one task at expense of the other

en.name: Meniere's Disease Management
en.description: Exercise strategies for managing Meniere's disease episodes
instructions: Practice balance exercises during symptom-free periods
Include habituation exercises for motion sensitivity
Learn techniques for managing acute episodes
Address anxiety related to unpredictable symptoms

en.name: ALS Respiratory Support Exercises
en.description: Respiratory exercises to maintain function in ALS
instructions: Perform breathing exercises to maintain chest wall mobility
common_errors: Not using assistive devices when needed

en.name: Muscular Dystrophy Functional Maintenance
en.description: Exercise program to maintain function in muscular dystrophy
instructions: Focus on maintaining range of motion and preventing contractures
Include respiratory exercises and postural drainage
Use assistive devices to maintain independence
Avoid overexertion that could damage muscles
common_errors: Exercising to point of muscle damage

en.name: Spinal Muscular Atrophy Exercise Adaptation
en.description: Adapted exercises for spinal muscular atrophy management
instructions: Focus on exercises that don't stress weak muscles
Include respiratory support and chest wall mobility
Use assistive technology for exercise participation
Maintain spinal alignment and prevent scoliosis
Adapt activities to individual functional level
common_errors: Trying to strengthen severely weakened muscles

en.name: Guillain-Barré Recovery Exercises
en.description: Progressive exercises for Guillain-Barré syndrome recovery
instructions: Begin with passive range of motion during acute phase
Progress to active assisted then active movements
Include respiratory exercises if respiratory involvement
Focus on functional activities as strength returns

en.name: Charcot-Marie-Tooth Exercise Program
en.description: Exercise program for hereditary motor sensory neuropathy
instructions: Focus on strengthening unaffected muscle groups
Include balance training for sensory loss
Use orthotics and assistive devices appropriately
common_errors: Trying to strengthen severely affected muscles
Avoiding use of helpful assistive devices

en.name: Autism Spectrum Disorder - Sensory Motor
en.description: Sensory-motor exercises for children with autism
instructions: Include proprioceptive and vestibular input activities
Use structured routines and visual cues
Include motor imitation and planning activities

en.name: Developmental Coordination Disorder Training
en.description: Motor skill training for developmental coordination disorder
instructions: Break complex movements into simple components
Use motor learning principles for skill acquisition
Include both gross and fine motor activities

en.name: Cerebral Palsy Spasticity Management
en.description: Exercises to manage spasticity and improve function
instructions: Use weight-bearing activities to reduce tone
Focus on activities of daily living skills
cues: Focus on function over pure movement
common_errors: Focusing only on range of motion

en.name: Down Syndrome Motor Development
en.description: Motor development exercises for children with Down syndrome
instructions: Include activities to improve motor planning

en.name: Complex Regional Pain Syndrome Desensitization
en.description: Graded exposure and desensitization for CRPS
instructions: Begin with gentle touch and texture exposure
Use mirror therapy for limb awareness

en.name: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome Pacing
en.description: Energy management and pacing strategies for CFS
instructions: Learn to recognize early fatigue signals
Break activities into smaller segments with rest
common_errors: Doing too much on good days

en.name: Hypermobility Exercise Stabilization
en.description: Joint stabilization exercises for hypermobile individuals
instructions: Focus on strengthening muscles around hypermobile joints
Avoid end-range positions that stress joints
Include proprioceptive training for joint awareness
cues: Don't push joints to end range

en.name: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome Management
en.description: Exercise program for Ehlers-Danlos syndrome

en.name: POTS Exercise Reconditioning
en.description: Graduated exercise program for POTS patients
instructions: Begin with recumbent or semi-recumbent exercise
Focus on leg muscle strengthening for venous return
Monitor heart rate and symptoms closely
Include salt loading and compression garments

en.name: Scapular Wall Slides
en.description: Improve scapular mobility and postural control
instructions: Place arms in W position against wall
Slide arms up wall while maintaining contact
Focus on squeezing shoulder blades together
cues: Squeeze shoulder blades down and back

en.name: Band Pull-Apart
en.description: Strengthen posterior shoulder and scapular muscles
instructions: Hold resistance band with both hands at shoulder height
Keep arms straight and pull band apart
